channel.title: Nordgarden
channel.description: Nordgarden is a Norwegian artist deriving from the American old school of classic songwriting.

item.title: Up the Hillside
item.dc:creator: michiel
item.content:encoded:
Up the hillside, upwards landslide In a car without a name We don’t need tags, nor labels To put us in the right frame Kiss me once more it feels so right To be playing out this game Oh, it feels so good to be feeling this way again
Misty mountains, love’s the fountain That makes these wheels turn around Safely guiding us, safely leading us Into a world within the sound Make it wide now, make it deep Make it real and make it true Oh, it feels so good to be feeling this way again
Let us leave every worry behind Leave out any kinds of trouble from our minds Feels so good, feels so right Feels so good now, feels so right
--------------------------------------------------------- Martin Windstad – drums, percussion Even Ormestad – bass Henrik Mosnes – piano, keyboards Audun Borrmann – baritone guitar Terje Nordgarden – vocals, acoustic guitars, keyboards, piano

item.title: The Path of Love
item.dc:creator: michiel
item.content:encoded:
I’m here to say that I completely understand your decision I sense your urge and your need for some sort of liberation But you must admit that there’s more to this There’s more on your mind Me being paranoid, trying to be clear in thoughts I try so hard to separate these two kinds And I pray
We will walk together along this path of love We won’t need no one but the one that we truly love The truth shall kill the pain, kill the lies that prevent us of Being real
Of love we’ve come, of love we are leaving Trying to follow this stony path called life Trying to add some sort of meaning But I must admit, I’m so scared of this I’m dying to find relief And you must admit, that there’s more to this There’s more than our eyes can see
--------------------------------------------------------- Martin Windstad – drums, percussion Even Ormestad – bass Henrik Mosnes – piano, keyboards Audun Borrmann – electric and baritone guitars Pete Hanafin – violins Terje Nordgarden – vocals, acoustic guitars, keyboards, piano

item.title: Stay Away
item.dc:creator: michiel
item.content:encoded:
Didn’t you hear just what I said Wasn’t the message clearly spelt Although I was drunk and lost that night I lost my head and I lost my sight Alright
Stay away now, stay away far from me
At night I wake up again and again With the blood pumping feverishly through my veins I wake up from a dream with a strange light With a strange girl and I pull her hair aside And I always see your face every time
Stay away now, stay away far from me
You did no good, you made a promise that was already broken You did no good, you spoke of everything But you left the truth unspoken You said it was all inside my head that this madness unfolded But how was I supposes to know then You didn’t even say goodbye
---------------------------- Martin Windstad – drums Even Ormestad – bass Henrik Mosnes – piano Pete Hanafin – violins Audun Borrmann – electric guitars Terje Nordgarden – vocals, acoustic guitars

item.title: On London Town
item.dc:creator: michiel
item.content:encoded:
Darkness falls on London Town The pale, dim light hardly touches the ground And leaves me alone with no one around I hold my pen like it was my life I chose my words with a silent sigh I say hello to the man with a dog passing by Good evening and good night I hum a melody I found Stomping my feet on the ground Thinking it’s strange how no one here makes a sound Here no one makes a sound
I wanna lose these things, I wanna lose these things I wanna lose these blues I found I wanna choose these things, I wanna choose these things I wanna choose these things away
I walk the streets and I find this scene I pass the palace, but I see no queen But the flags are on furl I heard the eagle landed here today And in awe they put everything his way But it’s certainly not my way
------------------------------ Alexander Pettersen - drums Lasse Weeden - bass Andreas Ulvo – piano,rhodes Peder Øiseth - trumpet Erik Johannessen - trombone Terje Nordgarden – vocals, acoustic guitars, electric guitars, tambourine

item.title: Oh Brother
item.dc:creator: michiel
item.content:encoded:
I’m waiting by this road Trying to get a ride To bring me over these mountains And on to the other side Oh brother can you help me through, Oh can’t you see I’m just like you
But all these people passing Their faces cut in stone The city left them faithless And helplessly alone This life is one long ride And everyday another stride We all need someone To help us to the other side
A wise man he once said You can do what you want to do But you ought to do to others Like you want them to do to you Oh sister can you help me through Oh can’t you see I’m just like you
---------------------------------- Henrik Maarud – drums Martin Windstad – percussion Bill Troiani - bass Lars Christian Narum – keyboard Audun Borrmann – electric guitar Tuva Sofie Andersen – vocals Terje Nordgarden – vocals, acoustic guitar

item.title: Capture
item.dc:creator: michiel
item.content:encoded:
Go capture this moment you’re in This harmony, this rarity within
Don’t call it a failure, don’t say it’s wrong That your heart has been aching for so very long
Let’s get over this Let’s be done with that Let’s get way beyond
---------------------------- Alexander Pettersen - drums Lasse Weeden - bass Andreas Ulvo – piano Henrik Mosnes - organ Peder Øiseth - trumpet Erik Johannessen - trombone Terje Nordgarden – vocals, acoustic guitars, 12-string acoustic guitar, electric guitar

item.title: So Far Away
item.dc:creator: michiel
item.content:encoded: (for my grandfather) So far away, so distant The way that I feel today Something missing The things that I wanted to say Remain only written The things that I wanted to do Uncommitted How that I miss you I can’t even make a sound How that I wish you Could still be here around How I remember That smile always on your face Sadly I realize There won’t be another day I woke up this morning To the trembling voice of my mother I heard she was crying I wish I could hold her But now I’m so far away I’m so distant The way that I feel today Something missing --------------------------- Alexander Pettersen - drums Lasse Weeden - bass Andreas Ulvo – piano, rhodes, clavinet, organ Peder Øiseth - trumpet Erik Johannessen - trombone Terje Nordgarden – vocals, acoustic guitars, 12-string acoustic guitar, electric guitar

item.title: In Hopes and Dreams
item.dc:creator: michiel
item.content:encoded:
The rain is falling down without a sound And leaves a layer on the city And paints the color grey all over town I am sitting here inside And I’m longing out I try to see some light in this life And I see but one
No one could tear this down except for you Anyone could tell me something, but not like you do Dreams and longing take me away into Dreaming of a future far away from here
The night is falling down without a sound And leaves a darkness on the city Outside the electric lights are shining dim And I am walking here alone And I’m heading home I try to see some stars above And I see but one
-------------------------- Terje Nordgarden – vocals, piano, melodica, acoustic guitar, tambourine

item.title: The Path of Love (Piano Version)
item.dc:creator: michiel
item.content:encoded:
I’m here to say that I completely understand your decision I sense your urge and your need for some sort of liberation But you must admit that there’s more to this There’s more on your mind Me being paranoid, trying to be clear in thoughts I try so hard to separate these two kinds And I pray
We will walk together along this path of love We won’t need no one but the one that we truly love The truth shall kill the pain, kill the lies that prevent us of Being real
Of love we’ve come, of love we are leaving Trying to follow this stony path called life Trying to add some sort of meaning But I must admit, I’m so scared of this I’m dying to find relief And you must admit, that there’s more to this There’s more than our eyes can see
--------------------- Henrik Mosnes – piano Terje Nordgarden - vocal

item.title: The Night
item.dc:creator: Nordgarden
item.content:encoded:
(Lyrics by Morphine)
You’re the night Lilah, the little girl lost in the woods You’re the folktale, the unexplainable
You’re the bedtime story, the one that keeps the curtains closed And I pray you’re waiting for me Cause I cannot make it on my own
It’s to dark to see the landmarks And I don’t want your good luck charms
I pray you’re waiting for me across your carpet of stars You’re the night Lilah, you’re everything that we can see Oh Lilah, you’re the possibility
You’re the bedtime story, the one that keeps the curtains closed And I pray you’re waiting for me Cause I cannot make it on my own
Unknown the unlit world of old You’re the sounds I’ve never heard before Of the map where the wild things grow Another world outside my door Here I stand, I’m all alone Driving down the pitch black road Lilah you’re my only home And I can’t make it on my own
------------------------------ Alexander Pettersen - drums Lasse Weeden - bass Andreas Ulvo – piano Henrik Mosnes - organ Terje Nordgarden – vocals, acoustic guitar, 12-string acoustic guitars, electric guitar

item.title: Keep It Shining On The Inside
item.dc:creator: michiel
